author: @Vijestime
title: Israel's defense minister: The UN agency for Palestinian refugees has lost its legitimacy
text: Israel's Defense Minister Yoav Galant said today that the United Nations Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) "has lost the legitimacy to exist in its current form", assessing that it is "Hamas with a facelift". "Funds from countries around the world are channeled through UNRWA and used to strengthen terrorist infrastructure and pay terrorists," Galant told a delegation of UN ambassadors visiting Israel, Israeli media reported. The delegation was led by Israel's ambassador to the UN, Gilad Erdan, the Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced, but did not specify who the members of the delegation were, nor which countries they represented, nor where they met. The statement added that the IDF (Israel Defense Forces) will continue to operate until they achieve their goals, the destruction of Hamas' military and governance capabilities and the return of the hostages to Israel. UNRWA, meanwhile, has again warned that it will no longer be able to function after February, given that many countries have suspended funding to the agency due to Israeli accusations that its employees participated in attacks on southern Israel on October 7, when the Israeli army's war against Hamas. As stated on Monday, the funds at its disposal could be used up by the end of February if more than a dozen countries do not back down from their decision to suspend support for the agency, due to accusations that 13 of its approximately 13.000 employees participated in unprecedented cross-border attacks. In those attacks, about 1.200 people were killed, mostly civilians, and about 250 hostages were kidnapped and taken to Gaza. More than 27.000 people were killed in Gaza, most of them women and children, in the Israeli revenge from the air, from the mines and from the sea, the Ministry of Health announced today. Bonus video:

author: AFP/Moscow
title: Two Russians get heavy prison terms for poetry against Ukraine assault
text:
A Moscow court yesterday sentenced two men to long prison terms for reading poems against the assault on Ukraine.
Artyom Kamardin was sentenced to seven years in prison and Yegor Shtovba to five years and six months to cries of ‚ÄúShame!‚Äù from their supporters in the courtroom, an AFP journalist at the hearing saw.
Russian authorities have detained thousands for simple acts of protest against the offensive in Ukraine, with criticism effectively outlawed.
Kamardin, 33, said his detention was particularly violent, claiming that officers raped him and forced him to film an apology video while threatening his girlfriend.
On the eve of his arrest he had recited his poem ‚ÄúKill me, militia man!‚Äù on a Moscow square where dissidents have been gathering since the Soviet era.
Kamardin also shouted offensive slogans against the imperial ‚ÄúNew Russia‚Äù project aiming to annex the south of Ukraine.
Both were convicted of ‚Äúinciting hatred‚Äù and ‚Äúcalling for activities threatening state security‚Äù.
Kamardin told the court he did not know his actions broke the law and asked for mercy.
‚ÄúI am not a hero, and going to prison for my beliefs was never in my plans,‚Äù he said in a statement, posted on his supporters‚Äô Telegram channel.
After the sentencing, his father Yury said: ‚ÄúThis is a total outrage!‚Äù
Around two dozen friends came to support the defendants along with the poets‚Äô parents and wives.
Kamardin‚Äôs wife Alexandra Popova was in the crowd.
‚ÄúIt is a very harsh sentence. Seven years for poems, for a non-violent crime,‚Äù she said, before being detained.
In an interview with AFP in late 2022, she had recounted her then boyfriend‚Äôs arrest, saying officers threatened her with ‚Äúgang rape‚Äù, hit her and sprayed superglue on her cheeks and mouth.
Meanwhile Kamardin was taken to a separate room, where ‚Äî as he told his lawyer ‚Äî he was beaten and raped with a barbell.
Kamardin was also forced to film an apology video.
Shtovba, 23, also insisted he did not break the law.
In his last statement in court, published by independent site Mediazona, he asked the judge: ‚ÄúWhat have I done that‚Äôs illegal? Read poetry?‚Äù He also addressed his mother, who he said depended on him financially.
‚ÄúMom, I know that you, more than anyone, believe in my innocence...Still, I‚Äôm sorry for how things turned out, leaving you and dad alone.‚Äù
Nikolai Dayneko, who was arrested at the same time, was sentenced to four years in prison last May after entering a pre-trial agreement, according to OVD-info.
This is the latest in a string of heavy sentences against Russians who protested the offensive, in trials critics denounce as absurd.
In mid-November judge Oksana Demiasheva sentenced artist Alexandra Skochilenko to seven years in prison for swapping price tags with slogans criticising Russia‚Äôs offensive in Ukraine.
Skochilenko had replaced five price tags in a branch of one of Russia‚Äôs largest supermarket chains in Saint Petersburg with messages about the conflict.
The trials of ordinary Russians usually take place away from public attention, unlike those of prominent critics.
Most of Russia‚Äôs high-profile opposition figures have fled the country or are behind bars, including Alexei Navalny.
Artyom Kamardin (left) and Yegor Shtovba. (AFP)

author: Edwin Montesinos Nolasco
title: Gobierno peruano ‚Äòtienta‚Äô involucrar a China en su agricultura: Ministro pidi√≥ apoyo para megaproyecto Pampas Verdes - Infobae
text:
Per√∫ solicit√≥ a China que se involucre en su proyecto estancado m√°s de 10 a√±os, conocido como Pampas Verdes. - Cr√©dito Composici√≥n Infobae/Edwin Montesinos/Andina/Agraria La visita de la presidenta Dina Boluarte a China y su reuni√≥n con diferentes autoridades y empresarios ha llevado a que el Per√∫ llegue a diferentes acuerdos en el que el r√©gimen asi√°tico se involucre con la econom√≠a digital peruana, la defensa comercial, protecci√≥n de los derechos del consumidor, las comunicaciones p√∫blicas, as√≠ como el desarrollo cient√≠fico y tecnol√≥gico, entre otros.
Si bien algunos ministros y la presidenta ya regresaron de aquella naci√≥n, el titular del Ministerio de Desarrollo Agrario y Riego , √Ångel Manero , se qued√≥ en China y en entrevista con RPP y Radio Nacional revel√≥ m√°s detalles de los tratos con este pa√≠s. Entre estos, est√° otro megaproyecto, uno que irrigar√≠a a m√°s de 200 mil hect√°reas y que servir√≠a para la agricultura,
China financiar√≠a Megaproyecto Pampas Verdes El ministro √Ångel Manero se√±al√≥ que adem√°s de la reuni√≥n con pa√≠ses de la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y Caribe√±os, esta visita ha permitido que se concreten acuerdos en una reuni√≥n bilateral con el viceministro de Agricultura de ese pa√≠s. ‚ÄúHemos sido precisos en solicitar cuatro protocolos fitosanitarios para el Per√∫‚Äù, se√±al√≥ Manero.
La presidenta, en su primera aparici√≥n p√∫blica tras el viaje a China, resalt√≥ los acuerdos que firmo con el pa√≠s asi√°tico. - Cr√©dito Composici√≥n Infobae/Captura de Presidencia Pero, adem√°s, el ministro mencion√≥ que se ha pedido a China que pueda financiar con otro megaproyecto , estancado desde hace m√°s de diez a√±os, llamado en su momento el primer megaproyecto regional del Per√∫ y que permitir√° irrigar 200 mil hect√°reas en tres regiones del Per√∫.
‚ÄúLe hemos pedido a China el apoyo t√©cnico-financiero para demostrar la viabilidad de un tremendo proyecto en el Per√∫, que es el proyecto hidroenerg√©tico de Pampas Verdes . Son m√°s de 200 mil hect√°reas de las pampas de Ica, norte de Arequipa, y la parte alta de Ayacucho. Implica la generaci√≥n dem√°s de mil 200 megavatios, y es una inversi√≥n muy grande, de m√°s de US$ 5 mil millones‚Äù, detall√≥ el ministro. De hecho, es de las inversiones m√°s grandes en un proyecto as√≠. Si bien se pide en un inicio demostrar la viabilidad del proyecto, ya el ministro dej√≥ entrever que este podr√≠a ir a manos del gigante asi√°tico, dado que se√±al√≥ que ‚Äúsolo pa√≠ses como China o del tama√±o de esta naci√≥n, tienen la oportunidad de financiar proyectos como este ‚Äù.
El titular del Midagri detall√≥ los acuerdos con China. - Cr√©dito Composici√≥n Infobae Para tener una idea, las 200 mil hect√°reas que irrigar√≠a el proyecto equivalen a casi la mitad de una regi√≥n como Tumbes. Esto implica que China potenciar√≠a a su vez la agricultura en las zonas de Arequipa, Ica y Ayacucho ; y si bien en Ayacucho hay un 24,9% de inseguridad alimentaria, seg√∫n el estudio Global Hunger Index de 2022 , el anuncio que ha dado el ministro tambi√©n va de la mano con el pedido de cuatro protocolos fitosanitarios que ha pedido el Per√∫ al pa√≠s asi√°tico, para exportar frutas congeladas, como mangos, ar√°ndanos y paltas, granadas, pecanas, as√≠ como carne de vacuno y porcino a este pa√≠s.
Esto implicar√≠a que el pa√≠s asi√°tico no solo financiar√≠a la infraestructura para que la agricultura florezca en estas regiones, sino que se beneficiar√≠a con nuevos productos que recibir√° como agroexportaci√≥n del Per√∫, pero esto implica algo m√°s.
China busca paliar su inseguridad alimentaria El ministro resalt√≥ que se han solicitado cuatro protocolos fitosanitarios muy importantes, para poder exportar nuevos productos. Estos son protocolos en:
Frutas congeladas : incluye mangos, ar√°ndanos y paltas. Mangos y paltas ser√≠an oferta de peque√±os productores Protocolo de granadas Protocolo de pecanas Tr√°mite para que Per√∫ pueda exportar carne de vacuno y porcino a China. En carne de vacuno ser√≠a una oferta potencial de productos andinos ‚ÄúLas cifras son potencialmente important√≠simas. En agroexportacion exportamos US$ 1.000 millones en este momento. Lo que se estar√≠a permitiendo con estos nuevos protocolos, solo en frutas congeladas, estamos hablando de US$ 100 millones en el corto plazo. En granadas y pecanas, estamos hablando de US$ 20 o 30 millones adicionales‚Äù, explic√≥ el ministro. China podr√≠a invertir en el proyecto de irrigaci√≥n Pampas Verdes, que ser√≠a vital para la agroexportaci√≥n que este mismo pa√≠s recibir√≠a de Per√∫. - Cr√©dito Andina China pagar√≠a millones de d√≥lares por estas carnes que Per√∫ exportar√≠a. ‚ÄúPero el gran potencial son en las carnes‚Äù, resalta el titular del Midagri . ‚Äú China consume 70 millones de toneladas de carne. Y si solo nos ponemos la meta de exportarle 1 mill√≥n de toneladas al mercado chino, en carne de vacuno y de porcino, estamos hablando de exportaciones de m√°s de S/5 mil millones, en el mediano plazo. Estamos hablando de incrementar nuestra agroexportaicones en un 50% solo con las carnes‚Äù, agreg√≥.
Pero, mientras Per√∫ se beneficiar√≠a con los millones en exportaci√≥n , el beneficio a China tambi√©n es evidente. Este a√±o el foco del pa√≠s asi√°tico se ha intensificado en la seguridad alimentaria . Al pa√≠s con una tasa creciente de poblaci√≥n le cuesta mantener a toda la poblaci√≥n alimentada.
‚ÄúChina (...) tiene una dolorosa historia de hambruna y debe alimentar a casi el 20% de la poblaci√≥n mundial con menos del 9% de su tierra cultivable y el 6% de sus recursos h√≠dricos‚Äù, se√±al√≥ Mei Mei Chu, corresponsal de agricultura en Reuters.
La parte de la tierra cultivable es importante y vital para entender esto. Seg√∫n el Centro de Estudios Estrat√©gicos e Internacionales (Center for Strategic and International Studies, CSIS) y el Consejo de Relaciones Exteriores (Council on Foreign Relations), ambas ONG estadounidenses, entre el 2013 y 2019, China report√≥ una disminuci√≥n de m√°s del 5% de su tierra cultivable , atribuida en gran medida a pr√°cticas agr√≠colas destructivas y a que los gobiernos locales reutilizaron tierras agr√≠colas para infraestructura y bienes ra√≠ces.
China buscar√≠a paliar su inseguridad alimentaria, pero Per√∫ tambi√©n se encuentra afrontando m√°s gravemente este problema. - Cr√©dito Infobae/Difusi√≥n China est√° buscando poder atender su problema de inseguridad alimentaria , y participar en un megaproyecto de irrigaci√≥n en un pa√≠s como el Per√∫, y aprobarles protocolos para que exporten m√°s all√° , estar√≠a en l√≠nea con esto. Si esto prospera, China podr√≠a usar a Per√∫ como su ‚Äòchacra‚Äô , financiando un proyecto de irrigaci√≥n que, si bien promover√≠a la agricultura peruana, podr√≠a ir dirigido a la agroexportaci√≥n del pa√≠s.
Esto podr√≠a ser preocupante, en tanto Per√∫ tambi√©n tiene su propio problema de inseguridad alimentaria . Una encuesta nacional realizada por Ipsos en octubre del 2023 revel√≥ que el 26% de la poblaci√≥n peruana ‚Äîtres de cada diez personas‚Äî afirmaron haber pasado, al menos, un d√≠a sin poder comer por la falta de recursos econ√≥micos, durante los √∫ltimos tres meses.

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Ruthless India Decimate England & Bazball Inside 3 Days To Clinch Series 4-1 In Dharamsala
text:
India produced a ruthless performance with the ball on Saturday to crush England by an innings and 64 runs in the fifth and final Test to clinch the series 4-1 in Dharamsala.
The hosts added just 4 runs to their overnight total of 473 before getting bowled out in the 125th over to take a massive first innings lead of 259 runs which took out any chances of an England fightback.
The visitors were expected to come out all guns blazing with their Bazball approach in the second innings but their plans were completely derailed by Ravichandran Ashwin, who ran through the England top-order with the new ball.
Ashwin takes five-for in his 100th Test
The Tamil Nadu off-spinner, playing his 100th Test, bagged his 36th five-wicket haul while vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav took a couple of scalps each as India bundled out England for 195 in less than three sessions on Day 3 to finish the match.
Former captain Joe Root was the only batter who showed some resistance towards the Indian bowling attack and tried his best to delay the inevitable with his innings of 84. But his knock was cut short before he could get to his 32nd Test hundred.
In the air and taken by Jasprit Bumrah! üí™
Kuldeep Yadav with the final wicket üòÉ
End of the match and series in Dharamsala ‚õ∞Ô∏è
Scorecard ‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/OwZ4YNua1o #TeamIndia | #INDvENG | @IDFCFIRSTBank pic.twitter.com/wlOYofabuC
‚Äî BCCI (@BCCI) March 9, 2024 \n\n
IND vs ENG: James Anderson Joins Muthiah Muralitharan & Shane Warne In Elite List With 700 Test Wickets; Viral Video Rohit & Gill star with the bat
Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill led India with centuries, complemented by notable fifties from debutant Devdutt Padikkal, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Sarfaraz Khan.
"When you win a Test like this, everything has to fall in place...The way bowlers took responsibility was pleasing to see," said an elated India captain Rohit Sharma.
Despite England's lackluster performance, James Anderson's achievement of taking his 700th wicket provided a glimmer of success for the visitors.
A 4‚É£-1‚É£ series win üôå
BCCI Honorary Secretary Mr. @JayShah presents the üèÜ to #TeamIndia Captain Rohit Sharma üëèüëè
Scorecard ‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/OwZ4YNua1o #INDvENG | @IDFCFIRSTBank | @ImRo45 pic.twitter.com/KKpRaaGbOU
‚Äî BCCI (@BCCI) March 9, 2024 \n\n
'...I'll Step Away From Cricket,' Says Rohit Sharma After Historic Test Series Win In Dharamsala Stokes concedes defeat to 'better' Team India
Ahead of the final game of their long tour, Stokes had dismissed theories of the departure lounge syndrome but with the way his batters performed, it seemed they were in a hurry to get back home.
"We have been outplayed by the better team of the series...When you look at the series as a whole, in those small moments we haven't been able to keep it going," he admitted at the end of a humbling outing.
Here are the summary scores:
England: 218 and 195 all out in 48.1 overs (Joe Root 84, Jonny Bairstow 39; Ravichandran Ashwin 5/77). India: 477 all out in 124.1 overs (Shubman Gill 110, Rohit Sharma 103, Devdutt Padikkal 65; Shoaib Bashir 5/173).
